document.docAuthor: Nielsen, Jørgen G., Pogonoski, John J. & Appleyard, Sharon A.
document.masterDocTitle: Aphyonid-clade species of Australia (Teleostei, Bythitidae) with four species new to Australian waters and a new species of Barathronus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Aphyonid-clade species of Australia (Teleostei, Bythitidae) with four species new to Australian waters and a new species of Barathronus

Other material : 22 non-Australian specimens ( 62–147 mm SL) listed in Nielsen 2015 from the Atlantic, Indian and western Pacific Oceans.
Size. Largest known specimen ( 148 mm SL) is a ripe female.

Remarks. Table 1 shows agreement in all 20 characters between the data for the two recently collected Australian specimens (NMV A 31828 -002 and NMV A 31841 -012) and the data from 29 specimens from most oceans (Nielsen 2015: 327).

Distribution ( Fig. 1 ). The present material was caught off southern Qld and northern NSW at 1013–2518 m depth and earlier 29 specimens were caught in the Atlantic, Indian and West Pacific Oceans (including seven from Australian waters) at depths of 625–2560 m .
